data.title: Great lunch spot on Walton Way
data.text:
Road by this place a hundred times. Going to lunch on the busy Walton Way is somewhat boring, lots of chains. This place is a great spot for lunch!
Lots of choices including Chinese. Fresh fish, chicken and sides. Generous portions and reasonable prices. On my favorite list for sure .

data.title: Delicious, just don't think about the calories.
data.text:
We were staying in a historic hotel near bye and saw this place listed on trip adviser. We visited and and we're glad we did. Despite a no frills appearance and limited service, the food is delicious. There was a steady stream of locals that came in while we were there that seemed to confirm our assessment of the food. We dabbled in the Chinese food and also ordered some fish and oysters. 

FYI, pretty much everything on the menu is fried. I suppose you could order another method of preparation, but I didn't see anyone else do it. Also, your choice of sides for platters consists of fries, hush puppies, and ham fried rice... Yeah, it's your cheat day, embrace the fried stuff. Vegetables? There was rumor of some cole slaw available, but why would you get slaw when you could have hush puppies?

The place isn't much to look parking is sparse, and service is limited to ordering and picking up at the counter. However, the food is edible comfort. I give this place a strong recommendation.

data.title: Amazing fish
data.text: This place is really a hole in the wall, but the prices are very low and the fish is just amazing. We had croaker.  Had never had it before, but it was really delicious! Just a few tables, but worth stopping in.

data.title: Best Chinese!
data.text: The best Chinese in town! I have turned all my friends on to it. Orange chicken etc. great prices and the family owned business is very friendly. 👍🏻👍🏻

data.title: Fresh catch and down home service
data.text:
This welcoming little place is run by a Chinese family that is happy to chat and happy to serve some of the best seafood in Augusta.  It's a simple place with a few formica tables whose clients mostly live close by and pick up the food to bring it home.  So you can call ahead and be sure the food will be ready quickly, or if you can't wait, grab a chair and soon you'll be joining a conversation with friendly folks from the neighborhood.

We usually order the large shrimp peeled and battered, with the rice house specialty.  But we also love the various fish that they display whole, and clean and gut for you on the spot.
For Christmas and Thanksgiving, be sure to order your oysters early.  They get them from Deleware and they arrive straight from the warf on a regular run.

data.title: Good fresh fish waiting for you!
data.text: I selected this place based on a previews review. This is a place where you do not want to go for a special occasion. However if you want good fish at a cheap price, this is the place to go. Service is excellent, food is good, and their prices are compare to eating at any rainbow restaurant. Place is small and very plain, yet very clean and well run.

data.title: Pick Your Fish and Get it Cooked!
data.text: This nondescript new fish market and restaurant is located near the Medical College. To get there, you have to drive through a less than desirable neighborhood unfortunately. There is limited parking, and the interior to the market/restaurant is pretty awful. That said, the fresh fish selection is fantastic. You can choose a fish, have them prepare it, and then cook it anyway you want. We opted for just ordering off the menu. I had 2 pcs of whiting and 12 fried shrimp. My husband had the seafood platter that included 2 pcs of tilapia, shrimp, scallops and oysters. We both loved our fish, fried in the lightest batter. You can get either hush puppies, french fries, or ham fried rice. This place also serves several Chinese dishes; I heard that the owner runs a Chinese restaurant just down the street. My advice would be to go, order your food, then take it home and enjoy it in your home surroundings; the interior is really pretty awful and because the fish prices are very reasonable, attracted a wide variety of customers. Would  we go again? Probably, the fish was just that good.
